Michigan Ongoing Health & Safety Training Refresher 2023
Section 3: Prevention & Control of Infectious Disease (Including Immunizations)

Participation Exercise:
Surface Hygiene Definitions

We are now going to discuss some terms regarding surface hygiene. Match the term with the proper definition. If you need an alternative activity, you can take this quiz. 

  1. Look at the examples and containers. The examples are represented as small blocks that you can drag, while the containers will be represented as larger boxes with dashed borders that you need to drop the examples into.
  2. Click and hold the example you want to move with your mouse or touch screen. The example should now follow your cursor or finger.
  3. Drag the example with your mouse or touch screen over the container in which you think it belongs.
  4. Release the example into the container by letting go of the mouse button or lifting your finger off the screen. The example should snap into place and change color to indicate that it's been dropped into the correct container.
  5. Repeat steps 1 to 4 for each example until you've completed the activity.

Please review the “Surface Hygiene Definitions” page and try again.

Nice job! You have correctly matched the surface hygiene terms to their definitions!

Terms

SanitizeCleanBodily fluidsDisinfect

Definitions

Eliminating all germs from inanimate surfaces using products registered with U.S. EPA

Removing dirt and debris by scrubbing with detergent and rinsing with water

Reducing germs on inanimate surfaces to levels considered safe by public health codes

Urine, feces, saliva, blood, nasal drainage, eye discharge, injury and tissue discharge
